Package corc.structure

Interface IDeck<C extends ICard>

  • Type Parameters:
    C - The subclass of ICard to be stored.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ICardset<C>, java.lang.Iterable<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Deck
    public interface IDeck<C extends ICard>
extends ICardset<C>
    A collection of cards used for a card game.

    Cards SHOULD be stored in a 'stack' manner. So if a Card is added to this, that same Card SHOULD be the first in line to be removed.

    Any game using this class SHOULD implement their own version of Deck, and MAY use the setDeck(IDeck) method to follow the singleton design pattern throughout a game implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeck

        static IDeck getDeck()
        Throws an MissingDeckException if no deck has been set.
        Returns:
        The stored Deck to be used across a game.

      • setDeck

        static void setDeck​(IDeck deck)
        Parameters:
        deck - The Deck to be used across a game.

      • drawCard

        C drawCard()
        SHOULD return the most recently added card.

        SHOULD throw an EmptyDeckException if there are no cards in this Deck.

        Returns:
        The next Card object stored in this.

      • reset

        void reset()
        SHOULD be called in the constructor.

        SHOULD contain all logic necessary for clearing any contained cards, and filling itself with all new cards required to play a card game.
